Within loop_1, create a circle (circle_1) with the following properties: - Center: [0.0425, 0.0425] - Radius: 0.0425 Step 3: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch using a Join Feature operation with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.4953 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.0849 Result This creates a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. 1. Loop\\_1 consists of the following curves: - 10 lines (line\\_1 to line\\_10) - The lines can be grouped into 4 pairs, each pair defining a side of the prism. - The start and end points of these lines are as follows: ```json line_1: [0.0, 0.6792], [0.0202, 0.0] line_2: [0.0202, 0.0], [0.064, 0.0] line_3: [0.064, 0.0], [0.0749, 0.0] line_4: [0.0749, 0.0], [0.1734, 0.0] line_5: [0.1734, 0.0], [0.1734, 0.0175] line_6: [0.1734, 0.0175], [0.0749, 0.0175] line_7: [0.0749, 0.0175], [0.0748, 0.6413] line_8: [0.0748, 0.6413], [0.175, 0.6915] line_9: [0.175, 0.6915], [0.1386, 0.75] line_10: [0.1386, 0.75], [0.0, 0.6792] ``` 5. Each line pair forms a rectangle with a slight curve along one side (the curved side of the prism). The curve is not explicitly defined in the JSON, but can be inferred from the arrangement of the lines. 6. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 7. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 8. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-direction by 0.0109 units to generate the 3D model. The final shape of the part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 0.75 units in length, 0.0109 units in width, and 0.75 units in height. The curved side has a radius of approximately 0.4155 units.</description>
